items.title: Robin Guenther, Architect of Healthy Hospitals, Dies at 68
items.abstract: Supporting the use of nontoxic construction materials, she co-wrote the first guide to building green health care facilities and designed them to be less austere.

items.title: Russia Blasts Ukrainian Cities, Including Biggest Use of Advanced Missiles
items.abstract: Of 81 missiles fired, six were hypersonic weapons, among Russiaâ€™s newest and most advanced, which are all but impossible to shoot down.

items.title: Is a Dam in Rural Portugal a Key to Our Alternative Energy Future?
items.abstract: When the Portuguese electric power grid needs more electricity, a large multinational power company releases millions of gallons of water from a dammed reservoir.

items.title: The U.S. Will Need Thousands of Wind Farms. Will Small Towns Go Along?
items.abstract: In the fight against climate change, national goals are facing local resistance. One county scheduled 19 nights of meetings to debate one wind farm.

items.title: A Suburban Experiment Aims for Free Energy
items.abstract: Twenty homes in a California subdivision are testing a zero net energy goal: to make at least as much energy as they use over a year.
